citation.article-title: Agarivorans albus gen. nov., sp. nov., a γ-proteobacterium isolated from marine animals.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Agarivorans (A.ga.ri.vo′rans. N.L. neut. n. agarum agar; L. part. adj. vorans devouring, destroying; N.L. adj. agarivorans agar-devouring).
Cells are rod-shaped and approximately 1·5–1·9×0·7–0·9 μm.
Spores are not formed; motile by single polar flagella.
Predominant cellular fatty acids are saturated and monounsaturated, straight-chain fatty acids.
The genus is affiliated to the γ-Proteobacteria and presently contains one species, Agarivorans albus, which is the type species.
